alert.note: Alert for Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 10:40AM MDT until May 30 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville affecting Weber County. .Although flows are expected to remain below flood stage, flows will remain near bankfull conditions. These flows will remain high, swift, and dangerous through early Tuesday. For the South Fork of the Odgen River...including Huntsville... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Continued high flows remaining near bankfull. * WHERE...South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 4.6 feet (986 CFS), low lying areas near the banks of the South Fork of the Ogden River below Causey Reservoir through the town of Huntsville will receive minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM MDT Monday the stage was 3.89 feet (658 CFS). - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady just below flood stage. - Action stage is 4.4 feet (880 CFS). - Flood stage is 4.6 feet (992 CFS). &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Keep children and pets away from riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday by 1200 PM MDT.
